Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, New York  10013.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER FOSTER.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, New York 10013.

Council Member Foster moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Quinn:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 176 8th Avenue, shall be subject to review by the Council. (Application no. 20015446 TCM.)

Items.Title:
Introduction and Reading of Bills
See Attached
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Schneiderman, Duane, Hassell-Thompson, Montgomery, Sampson and Stachowski, S.2421-A and Assembly Members Dinowitz, Klein, Greene and Kaufman, et al, A.1045-A, "AN ACT to dedicate the Jerome Park Reservoir tract in the Bronx as parkland".
Items.MatterName: Dedicate the Jerome Park Reservoir tract in the Bronx as parkland (S.2421-A, A.1045-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Santiago, Markowitz, Mendez, Montgomery and Smith, S.1064 and Assembly Member Lentol, A.622, "AN ACT to authorize the commissioner of the New York city department of parks and recreation to provide for the increased patrol by enforcement officers of McCarren park, Fort Green park, Commodore John Barry park and McGoldrick park in Brooklyn, Kings County".
Items.MatterName: Authorize commissioner for the increased patrol by enforcement officers of McCarren park, Fort Green park, Commodore park, John Barry park and McGoldrick park in Brooklyn, Kings County (S.1064, A.622)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Santiago, Kruger, Lachman, Markowitz, Mendez and Smith, S.2449 and Assembly Members Ortiz and Lopez, A.4460, "AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to creating the Kings county industrial development agency".
Items.MatterName: Creating the Kings county industrial development agency (S.2449, A.4460)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Ortiz, A.5535, "AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to prohibiting the display of pornographic magazines or materials by street vendors in cities of one million or more".
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the display of pornographic magazines or materials by street vendors (A.5535)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Members Ortiz, Dinowitz, Towns and Seddio, et al, A.5377, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the suspension of alternate side of the street parking regulations".
Items.MatterName: Suspension of alternate side of the street parking regulations (A.5377)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Lachman, Kruger, Markowitz, Mendez, Onorato and Sampson, S.1406, and Assembly Member Hikind, et al, A.7603, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to temporarily suspending property owner's duty to remove snow, ice and dirt from sidewalks during certain times".
Items.MatterName: Temporarily suspending property owner's duty to remove snow, ice and dirt from sidewalks (S.1406, A.7603)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to restructure the membership of the central Board of Education, by providing the New York City Council with the power to select five Board members and the Mayor with the power to select four Board members, thereby ensuring greater accountability and parental input in the public school system.
Items.MatterName: Board of Education, Restructure Membership

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing the month of March 2002 as Women's History Month and encouraging all New Yorkers to observe this occasion with appropriate ceremonies and activities.
Items.AgendaNote: IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION or Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Women's History Month, March 2002

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Boyland, et al, A.3343, "AN ACT to authorize the city of New York to reconvey certain real property owned by Rabiah Thomas in the borough of Brooklyn without pubic auction".
Items.MatterName: In rem, Rabiah Thomas, Brooklyn (A.3343)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Boyland, et al, A.3850, "AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owner Mount Calvary United American Free Will Baptist Church, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; block no. 1558, lot no. 25 on tax map for the borough of Brooklyn".
Items.MatterName: In rem, Mount Calvary United American Free Will Baptist Church, Brooklyn (A.3850)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the repair of leaks occurring in certain portions of service pipes by the Department of Environmental Protection.
Items.MatterName: Leak Repair Service Pipes

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a computerized database containing information relating to the storage and handling of hazardous substances and emergency responses to the release of hazardous substances.
Items.MatterName: Hazardous Substance Database

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to hiring on construction projects funded by the city.
Items.MatterName: Construction Project Hiring

Items.Title: Resolution urging Mayor Bloomberg not to reject a waiver offered by the federal and State governments that would expand access to food stamps for hungry New Yorkers.
Items.MatterName: Expand access to food stamps.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the charter of the city of New York, in relation to the preparation and maintenance of a citywide prequalified vendors list.
Items.MatterName: Prequalified vendors list, Preparation & Maintenance

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to amend the Election Law, requiring a "full-face" ballot, which substantially hinders the City and State from considering advanced voting technologies that promise to greatly improve the election process and enhance democratic participation.
Items.MatterName: Amend Election Law, requiring a "full-face" ballot.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting Senate bill 3378-B regarding persons eligible for pharmaceutical cost assistance.
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse & Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Persons eligible for pharmaceutical cost assistance.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to adopt Senate bill 1165-A, and its companion, Assembly bill 3972-A, which would amend the executive law in relation to limiting the cost-sharing responsibilities of eligible participants in the elderly pharmaceutical insurance coverage program.
Items.MatterName: Elderly Pharmaceutical Insurance Coverage Program (S.1165-A)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council of the City of New York to hold hearings on the City's neglect of the repair, maintenance, cleanliness, and safety of the City's 93 stepstreets, and further, on the establishment of an inter-agency task force on stepstreets.
Items.MatterName: Stepstreets Neglect, Hearings

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the City of New York to set aside fifteen percent of the monies received from the Federal Assets Forfeiture Fund to support anti-crime programs of community- based organizations as allowed by the "permissible pass-through" regulation of the United States Department of Justice.
Items.MatterName: Federal Assets Forfeiture Fund

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the City of New York to maintain the wages of 3,500 Parks Opportunity Workers at $9.38 an hour, with benefits, instead of transferring them to a program with wages of only $7.95 an hour, and calling on the appropriate committee of the Council to hold hearings on the implementation of a welfare-to-work program in City agencies at a living wage, with benefits.
Items.MatterName: Maintain wages of Park Opportunity Workers at $9.38 an hour.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the City of New York to join the coalition calling for the immediate shutdown of the Indian Point Nuclear Facility until safety studies are completed and adequate security measures are taken.
Items.MatterName: Immediate shutdown of Indian Point Nuclear Facility.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a ballfield name, Bobby Bello Field, Borough of Brooklyn.
Items.MatterName: Name Change, Bobby Bello Field, Brooklyn

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the displaying of the POW/MIA flag
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: POW/MIA Flag Displaying

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, to mandate the presence of the American Flag at every parade held within the City, and to have it prominently displayed at the beginning of each parade.
Items.MatterName: American Flag, Parades

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting loitering for the purpose of buying or selling illicit drugs.
Items.MatterName: Loitering, Selling Drugs

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature and the Governor to authorize the City of New York to increase the maximum amount of tax it can levy on cigarettes under the City's Cigarette Tax, increase the maximum amount of tax it can levy on beer and liquor, and allow the City to impose a small tax on wine, to assist the City in raising desperately needed revenue.
Items.MatterName: Cigarette, Beer, Liquor and Wine Taxes

Items.Title: Resolution urging the State Legislature to reject demands to dismantle or abolish Community School Boards in the City of New York.
Items.MatterName: Reject demands to dismantle or abolish Community School Boards in NYC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to designating the motto of the borough of Staten Island as the borough of parks.
Items.MatterName: Designate Staten Island as the Borough of Parks.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to prohibiting the desecration of cemetery plots and burial places.
Items.MatterName: Cemetary Plots, Desecration Prohibited

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to adopt Assembly Bill A.9556, which amends Section 6206 of the Education Law, in relation to requiring that the Board of Trustees of the City University of New York charge the same rate of tuition that is charged to State residents to any person who is an immigrant alien, who attended a secondary or high school in the State and received a high school diploma within the State, or who obtained a general education diploma issued within the State.
Items.MatterName: CUNY Tuition, Board of Trustees

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to Staten Island ferry service.
Items.MatterName: Staten Island Ferry Service

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to abating rats as a requirement for foundation or earthwork permits.
Items.MatterName: Rat Abatement requirement for foundation or earthwork permits.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to enforcement and penalties of premises discharging into the sewer system.
Items.MatterName: Premises Discharge Sewer System, Penalties

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon Verizon Communications and the New York State Public Service Commission to change the 646 area code, assigned to the Borough of Manhattan, to a number that will not conflict with a local exchange, and in the future, to not issue new area codes that conflict with one of the City's local exchanges.
Items.MatterName: Public Service Commission, Change 646 area code

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the naming of city streets and parks.
Items.MatterName: Naming of City Streets & Parks

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting any motor vehicle other than a passenger car to park within fifteen feet of a street corner.
Items.MatterName: Prohibit parking other than passenger car within 15 feet of corner.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the use of racial or ethnic profiling by members of the police department.
Items.MatterName: Prohibit the use of racial or ethnic profiling by members of the Police Dept.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to promulgate rules governing the use of portable telephones on the New York City mass transit system.
Items.MatterName: MTA, Rules Portable Telephones

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to approve, Assembly Bill 9203-B relating to the creation of a brownfields site assessment, acquisition, and remediation assistance program.
Items.MatterName: Creation of a brownfields site assessment.  (A.9203-B)

Items.Title: Resolution declaring February Dominican Heritage Month, celebrating Dominican heritage and culture, and recognizing the contributions of Dominican-Americans to the City of New York.
Items.AgendaNote: IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION or Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Declaring February Dominican Heritage Month

Items.Title: Resolution in support of President George W. Bush's pledge to utilize the full resources of the United States government to apprehend and bring to justice those responsible for the kidnapping and murder of Wall Street Journal reporter Daniel Pearl.
Items.AgendaNote: IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION or Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Justice for Wall Street Journal Reporter Daniel Pearl.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to halt the flow of all consumer products in the United States from nations deemed by the State Department as supporting terrorism.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Halt consumer products to those supporting terroism.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to the enhancement of protection of whistleblowers.
Items.MatterName: Whistle Blowers, Enhanced Protection

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the annual disclosure of financial interests by certain officers and employees of the city of New York.
Items.MatterName: Annual Disclosure of Financial Interests

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the removal of snow and ice from operational motor vehicles twelve hours or more after the cessation of snowfall.
Items.MatterName: Removal of snow and ice from operational motor vehicles.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Santiago, S.790, "AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owner George Black, or if he is deceased, to the person or persons who would have inherited said property from him, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 1762, Lot No. 62 on tax map for the borough of Brooklyn".
Items.MatterName: In rem, George Black, Brooklyn (S.790)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the City of New York to end the ban on vehicles with a single occupant from entering Manhattan between 6 AM and 10 AM south of 60th Street other than the restrictions imposed at the Brooklyn Battery Tunnel.
Items.MatterName: End ban on single occupant vehicles entering manhattan.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the preparation of reports on city waterfront property and citywide needs.
Items.MatterName: Annual report of city-owned property in the waterfront.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State legislature to extend the provisions of the "Loft Law" and to expand its application to provide for the legalization of lofts occupied for residential purposes for a period of twelve consecutive months between January 1, 2000 and December 31, 2001 and to enact A.05578A, A.05579 and A.05580B, or similar legislation, and any respective companion legislation.
Items.MatterName: Extend provisions of the "Loft Law"

Items.Title: Landmarks Preservation Commission designation no. DL - 332, LP - 2108, pursuant to §3020 of the New York City Charter, concerning the designation of the Brooklyn Clay Retort and Firt Brick Works Storehouse, located at 76-86 Van Dyke Street, Borough of Brooklyn, Council District no. 38, as a landmark.
